snippet: The conclusion came in a final report on the successes and failures of the Millennium Development Goals, a set of targets established 15 years ago to improve the lives of the poor.
abstract: Part of final United Nations report on the successes and failures of the Millennium Development Goals finds severe poverty worldwide has fallen sharply in past 15 years; report confirms global efforts to improve lives of poor have saved millions of people, but it is not known what role Millennium Goals played overall; findings are likely to figure in summer debates over UN's next set of development goals, to be adopted by September.
lead_paragraph: The conclusion came in a final report on the successes and failures of the Millennium Development Goals, a set of targets established 15 years ago to improve the lives of the poor.

headline.main: Global Poverty Drops Sharply, With China Making Big Strides, U.N. Report Says
headline.print_headline: Global Poverty Drops Sharply, but Gains Are Uneven
